full_summary:
**TBIPS-IT Security Design Specialists for SIAS**

**Procurement Reference:** 24-258378

**Solicitation Method:** Competitive Selective Tendering

**Closing Date:** 2024-05-21 2:00 PM EST

**Overview**
Global Affairs Canada is seeking proposal from qualified vendors for IT security services through the Task-Based Informatics Professional Services (TBIPS) arrangement. The services will be used by the Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD) to support its IT security needs.

**DSTAE (Statement of Work) Components**
- The successful vendor will be required to provide IT security design services to support high-priority IM/IT projects, initiatives, and supporting Change Requests (CRQs) to facilitate the Security Assessment and Authorization (SA&A) process required by TBS, before an IM/IT system can go live in the Government of Canada.
- The vendor will provide security risk assessment, management, and mitigation services to bolster and augment the existing IT security team within DFATD.
- The expected outcome for the contract is to hire IT Security design specialists (up to five (5) to perform IT security design tasks.

**Key Requirements**
- IT Security risk assessment, management and mitigation services
- IT security design support for high-priority IM/IT projects, initiatives and supporting CRQs
- Compliance with security requirements, including data and information system protection from cyber-attacks and data theft.

**Accessible file formats**: None listed

**Code.** UNSPSC 80101507, 80161604, 81160000

**TA(Hierarchy)**. Canada - Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA) accord plus and World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)

**Schedule**: Successful vendors will be required to begin delivery within 12 months of the contract award (not to exceed 5 months of delivery) and to deliver to the Government of Canada between 201-275 hours each of up to 5 resources.

**Evaluation Criteria:** Proposals will be evaluated using the “Highest Combined Rating of Technical Merit and Price”

This request for proposal closes on May 21, 2024. Global Affairs Canada will respond to questions regarding this requirement directly to the shortlisted suppliers. 

**Code**: This procurement under the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA) Accord
